content.html:
Serious question: outside of outsized, unvested stock on the line or high compensation, why would any software engineer with options consider working at Twitter, going forward? Policies changing overnight and an owner acting visibly hostile towards staff who built Twitter.
twitter.com/GergelyOrosz/s…
content.value:
Serious question: outside of outsized, unvested stock on the line or high compensation, why would any software engineer with options consider working at Twitter, going forward?

Policies changing overnight and an owner acting visibly hostile towards staff who built Twitter.

content.html:
My question on “who would work at Twitter, given options” now includes that of working there you should expect to receive criticism in public, and firing on the spot for responding in public. The pool of experience sw engineers who would choose Twitter just shrank some more.
twitter.com/gergelyorosz/s…
content.value:
My question on “who would work at Twitter, given options” now includes that of working there you should expect to receive criticism in public, and firing on the spot for responding in public.

The pool of experience sw engineers who would choose Twitter just shrank some more.
